text.front:
Exploiting Cooccurrence on Corpus and
Document Level for Fair Crosslanguage Retrieval
Andreas Juffinger, Roman Kern and Michael Granitzer
Know-Center,
Graz
ajuffinger,rkern,mgranitzer@know-center.at
Abstract
In this paper we describe the methodology, architecture and implementation of the
information retrieval system we have developed for the Robust WSD Task at CLEF
2008. Our system is based on an extensive query preprocessing step for homogeni-
sation of the corpus queries. The preprocessing of queries includes: firstly, an query
expansion step based on Wordnet Synonsyms or an Associative Index, secondly a query
translation step based on corpus article cooccurrence in Wikipedia, and thirdly a stan-
dard disjunct index search in the CLEF corpus. The crosslanguage enabled system
behaves thereby as much as possible fair over different languages. We apply the same
preprocessing steps, independent of the query and corpus language, to all queries.
